title: Effective Language Education Design Utilizing Diagram Visualization

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental instructional design concepts and language pedagogy theories
context.additional_context: A course designed for pre-service and in-service teachers to cultivate the ability to design diagrams applicable to language curricula.

learning_goals: Learners can select three or more types of diagrams (flowcharts, concept maps, hierarchical structures) appropriately to represent complex language learning processes.
Learners can compare different diagram designs conveying the same content to analyze cognitive load reduction effects.
Learners create and validate the effectiveness of two or more customized diagrams suitable for language education contexts in project-based assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
